pros: great, pay , good people and cultye
cons: great company , good people and culture

job_title: Public Relations and Team Support in Little Rock, AR
pros: Giving kids the opportunity and watching them accomplish things they never thought would have been possible for them. Seeing them find there place in life.
cons:
I need to specify, NOT on a Regional level, but at HQ there was a lot of micromanaging and redundancy. It took my time away from teams and educating the public and other educators about STEM and the FIRST ROBOTICS program. 
Otherwise, the then Regional Director, Meredith Novak, was amazing to work with! The President of FIRST, Don Bossi, is a great person and showed he cared.

review_title: Company mission is awesome - organization VERY topheavy
pros:
The programs that FIRST facilitates for kids are really great, and it is wonderful to be a part of it.
Most positions get to travel at least once a year
Many wonderful people work there
Most people can wear jeans to work
Most positions allow at least one remote (work from home) day, some managers are very flexible
cons:
Upper management very out of touch with day to day operations and unwilling to hear the feedback that customers have
Very little advancement opportunity
Low pay and even lower annual raise
Management is not receptive to feedback, nor are they trained in people managing

review_title: Great place to help inspire the next generation
pros: Scope of work spans around the globe, pulls together leaders of companies who see the importance of STEM and students adopting those skills, and attracts the best volunteers you can imagine.
cons: Decision making can be tough at times with many different parties having input. This can make taking positive actions harder and longer to implement.

review_title: great mission,  complex,  room for improvement
pros: Passionate people, programs really have an impact, great President
cons: Founder can be very disruptive, the organization needs big changes but many leaders have been a long time and don't want change, nearly all staff have to travel 2 weeks in April, volunteers need to feel more valued

pros: Great to support a good cause, working with LEGO and so many amazing kids and dedicated volunteers.
cons: Leadership does not practice "Gracious Professionalism" as they preach to through their programs. Leadership does not value innovation. No room for growth. Pay is low. Employee appreciation is very low.

job_title: FRC Mentor in Clifton Park, NY
pros: Working with FIRST Robotics students is one of the most rewarding life experiences a professional can have.
cons: It's always easy to dive in headfirst, but one must remember that these long hours can be taxing on one's professional life.

review_title: A positive work environment lead by a leadership team with the highest level business acumen and integrity.
job_title: Human Resources Manager in Manchester, NH
pros: Always challenging, lots of opportunities to grow your skills.
cons: Pace.  We work with a sense of urgency because what we do matters to our community.

review_title: New President has no idea of how a not for profit should run or how to lead people
pros: Good mission, but really disconnected from reality of local schools and students
cons: Soooo highly political, mostly good people, but many have hidden agendas around their program or area they support

review_title: Super Fast Paced, Lost in the Shuffle
cons: Too much work for too few people, gloss over problems instead of addressing, mean co-workers, no one even says Hi when passing.

pros: Meeting people, helping kids get excited about STEM
cons: Say goodbye to your life. Don't expect that your head work will be recognized.
